Fields.DialogueText: "Dear Takao, I am writing to thank you for your last letter. The war has not been easy for anyone, but Chikuma and I have learned a great deal about each other."
"Dear Takao, Chikuma reminds me that it's impolite not to write back to you in response to your last letter even though it's vastly easier to talk to you by..."
*ALARM*
Captain, we need you on the bridge!
@BATTLE
Now to finish my letter... Let me get out the pen and paper again.
Ohayou gozaimasu!
Chikuma, hello. I was writing a letter, but now I can't find it.
... seems a little odd.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, it really is. I left it right here.
Help me look for it, would you?
Did you take it?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe you should look around for it.
Maybe later, Kanchou.
Don't blame me. I just got here.
Right. Anyway, what did you need?
Actually, I lost something too.
What did you lose?
My necklace.
Probably not.
Chikuma. Mr. Kishibe. Sorry to intrude.
What are you two up to?
Kishibe is telling me about what it's like to be dead.

Fields.MenuText: ... But he's clearly alive.
What do you mean?
Dead man walking!

Fields.DialogueText: Luckily, he is alive now because he was revived. When he was injured, there was a period when his heart stopped beating for long enough that he could technically be considered dead.
When Kishibe was injured, there was a period of time when his heart stopped beating. Of course, the medics were able to revive him.
When he was in the sick bay, his heart stopped beating for a long time. So, technically, he was dead before being revived.
That's pretty amazing.
I do believe I'm a lucky man.
So lucky!
I also have great friends. I have you two to thank, of course.
*ALARM*
Get ready!
Let's go!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, there are Funayūrei approaching. Brace yourself for the alarm.
@BATTLE
You two still at it?
Hai! We're talking about Kishibe's experience again.

Fields.MenuText: Fair enough. What was it like to be dead, Kishibe?
Can you really say you died if you're not dead now?
Maybe you should write a book about it.

Fields.DialogueText: Well...
I'm not sure. I do remember what happened.
It's so hard to put into words. I'm not sure I could. It's... okay, let me try again.
I saw everything I'd ever done in front of me, like a bunch of photographs on a table.
Oh, go on.
Then I felt a warm light, which seemed like everything anyone could ever know. Then the medic started calling my name, and I came back.
There was one more thing. I saw an eye closing. It wasn't my eye... It was just a strange eye.
The strange eyes? I had seen them in my dream before Chikuma performed her impromptu exorcism.
That's not something I would have ever believed before all of this happened to me, but now...
It's different.
Right. I appreciate the warning.
Chikuma?
Here, Kanchou! Can I help you?
Maybe - I was just curious about something. Did you ever find your necklace?
No. I seem to have run out of places to look for it, too.

Fields.MenuText: Hm. I could never find the letter I was writing.
Do you think someone took it?
Right. We need to start considering the possibility of theft.

Fields.DialogueText: At least you can just write a new one. I don't think I can get a new necklace.
It's possible - but I can't imagine who would do such a thing.
Do we? I can't imagine any of my crew being so bad.
Your necklace, was it valuable?
It sure was valuable to me.
What do you mean?
Well...
*ALARM*
...for another time.
@BATTLE
"Dear Takao, I'm writing you to..."
Kanchou...
Oh, Chikuma.
I hope I'm not disturbing you, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: No, not at all. What's the matter?
I'm trying to rewrite this letter. Can it wait?
No, I'm just rewriting the letter. What is it?

Fields.DialogueText: I was going to tell you about the necklace I lost.
Well, this is what I was hoping to speak to you about - the missing things.
I wanted to speak about the things that have gone missing.
Yes, your necklace. Why is it so valuable to you?
I wear it as a symbol of Japan.
I see. What does it look like? I'll help you find it.
It has a cute little deer on the end.
Which symbolizes Japan how?
No, the deer is just very cute. It's the inscription on the other side that really symbolizes Japan - for me, at least.
*ALARM*
I'm never going to finish this damn letter, am I?
@BATTLE
It... oh. Oh, dear.
Captain!
Officer Guzman, I wanted to ask you...
Captain, I believe we have an urgent issue. We may have spotted some Morganas ahead.
Right. Remind me we need to talk when this is done.
*ALARM*
There they are!
@BATTLE
I wanted to ask you if you'd seen a necklace.
A what?
My deer necklace. Have you seen it?
GAH!

Fields.MenuText: Chikuma, don't scare the Lieutenant like that.
Hello, Chikuma. We were just talking about you.
I don't think he's seen it, Chikuma.

Fields.DialogueText: Oops, my mistake.
Hai. I know. That's why I appeared.
Oh, I guess he hasn't...
Chikuma, how could we be losing things when you seem to know about everything that happens on this ship?
I don't see everything all the time, Kanchou. It's like... how often do you really pay attention to your toes if they're not in pain?
Yes, Captain.
Sorry! Sorry! Still not used to the... suddenly appearing thing.
Right.
I'm going to do you the favor of treating that as a rhetorical question, by the way.
Right. Now I may finally be able to finish writing this letter.
Except now my pens are all gone.
This is too strange.
It's time to start demanding answers from the crew, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Agreed. We clearly have a thief aboard.
Let's not jump to conclusions.
Unless it's Morgana "spirits" again.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, Kanchou. We'll find him. Or her.
I'm not jumping. I'm strolling toward conclusions at a reasonable pace.
Hm. Let's eliminate the more obvious explanations first.
I'll assemble the crew.
*ALARM*
... Yeah, I should've seen that coming.
@BATTLE
Captain, we're almost in range.
Everyone be ready. The pre-battle gloating could start any minute.
@BATTLE
Lieutenant.
Captain?
There's no good way to ease into this - Chikuma and I have both had things go missing. The losses have mostly been trivial-
I respectfully disagree!
Regardless, if we're talking about a thief, it's really brazen stuff - correspondence taken off my desk, for one thing.
Was that French?
Stay focused.
Um. Pardon my French, Captain.
We've had more reports than usual of things going wandering, but I hadn't really been thinking crime wave. Stealing from the Captain, though....
Kanchou, we really need to talk to the full crew.
Agreed. Lieutenant, I need you to set that up.
Understood.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, my losses have been mostly trivial.
It's jewelry, Chikuma, not state secrets.
Okay, fine. Personal stuff has been taken and we're both pissed off.

Fields.DialogueText: But, Kanchou...
Sorry, I know it's important to you. Still, perspective.
Attention, crew!
Nē, kiite!
This is war. It's unfortunate that such questions need to be asked, but I'm afraid... I'm not sure if this is due to national rivalry... I'm not sure.
Ah, just say it...

Fields.MenuText: Things around this ship have been going missing. If they're returned to my office in the next twenty-four hours, that'll be the end of it.
I hope this is just a misunderstanding, but we have to ask. Have any of you been collecting our items without permission?
I'm asking you all to stay vigilant. Things are going missing, and in a war like this we can't be complacent about it.

Fields.DialogueText: If they're not returned, things will be a lot more serious!
It's unacceptable to have a thief fighting alongside us.
If anyone has any idea where the stolen goods are, speak up!
So, no one has anything to volunteer?
*ALARM*
Oh! Prepare for battle.
@BATTLE
Captain, I have some news that might be interesting to you.
Go on, Guzman.
This is about the thief?

Fields.MenuText: Chikuma, what are you doing here?
I think it's best to let me handle this, Chikuma.
Yes, Officer Guzman, is it about the thief?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it just seemed so important, Kanchou.
Oh, but I think I should know, Kanchou.
I really want to get to the bottom of this.
*ALARM*
Morganas again!
@BATTLE
Lieutenant!
Yes, Captain?
Continue what you were saying before. Would it happen to be about the missing items?
Yes, Captain. First, I noticed my favorite drinking glass had disappeared. Then I heard from an anonymous crewmember who told me that he had seen the same kind with another crew member.
Who was the crewmember?
Her name is Elizaveta Mihaelova. I don't know her well - she's a fairly new arrival.
Hm. I think I remember her face, but I don't know much about her either.
Sounds like it might be a good idea to correct that.
Chikuma!
Kanchou? How can I help?
We have a suspect.
We should act now, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
We may want to consider this at a later time.
Indeed.
@BATTLE
We are - or, rather, Lieutenant Guzman is. That's what I wanted to talk to you about.
He's undertaking a very quiet investigation of Ensign Mihaelova. We don't want to tip her off if she's guilty, and we don't want to cast suspicion on her if she's innocent.
I can help!
Soon. But, for now, I just wanted to make sure that you were in the loop, and-
Are those Morganas I'm seeing on the horizon, or is it just a mirage that -
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Chikuma!
Oh, Kanchou! Gomen nasai!
What took you so long?
Well, I was using this break in the action to create a new woodblock print.
Chikuma, we should discuss...
Captain, I have some news about Elizaveta.
Our suspect?
I think it's fair to say she's our thief - we have evidence now. Our anonymous tipster has been in touch again.
What is this evidence?
Here's the Captain's pen, found under her bunk.

Fields.MenuText: Well, that's damning.
Things are starting to add up - but we should avoid letting our suspicions get ahead of us.
My pen! Oh, baby, I've missed you!

Fields.DialogueText: She must be the thief.
It seems very likely that she is the thief now, Kanchou.
Excuse me. It's time for me to do a maintenance walk.
Of course. Carry on, Lieutenant.
... So. Why would she bother to steal a pen in the first place?
And...
And I do wonder who this anonymous crew member is.
Yeah, okay.
Chikuma?
Granted. But the phrase "anonymous tipster" makes me a bit uneasy.
Exactly.
Ah, Chikuma, this is what you're working on now?
Hai! My newest print.
This is traditional woodblock work? And you can keep your hands steady enough to pull it off on the open sea? Color me impressed.
If you tell me what color that is, exactly, I'll see what I can do.

Fields.MenuText: What you're working on now is excellent.
It seems peaceful.
I'm surprised you have the patience for this.

Fields.DialogueText: It is nothing much, Kanchou.
It is very peaceful.
It is good to take some to slow your mind, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
Sorry.
It's all right. I'll pick up where I left off when the enemy's defeated.
@BATTLE
Heh.
Chikuma!
Chikuma, there you are.
You called, Kanchou?
I did. Listen, I don't know what the story is with Ensign Mihaelova, but my gut says we're being manipulated - so I don't want to just haul her off in chains.
Oh, that does not seem like a job I want...

Fields.MenuText: There's nobody I trust more.
Well, who do you think should do it instead?
I should do it instead of you, then.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Hai. Yes, okay. I'll do it then.
... Hai. You're right. I'll do it.
... Gomen nasai, Kanchou. I spoke without thinking. It is my duty. I'll do it.
Anything that happens on this ship is also happening to me, so I should be the one to take the initiative.
And you can do it without calling attention to yourself. Catch her when she's alone.
Hai. I won't let you down, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
Morganas!
Time for action!
@BATTLE
I want you to talk to her. See what light she can shed on what's going on. Maybe it'll turn out she's a kleptomaniac and that'll be end of it, but if she's not...
Yes, what is it? You look anxious.
Captain, a large fleet of Morganas has been spotted.
@BATTLE
Chikuma?
Ohayou!
Well, have you done it?
Hai. I've spoken with Elizaveta.
... And?
There isn't really any new evidence, but... I think your gut was correct, Kanchou.
What did she say?
She claimed that the items we found simply appeared in her room.

Fields.MenuText: I was hoping for something a little bit more persuasive than that.
And you found that credible?
So if we take her at her word, she's being framed and we have no leads.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe it doesn't seem convincing secondhand, but I think you might feel differently if you spoke to her.
I did. I do, actually. She doesn't seem to be lying or deceptive.
I know. But I really don't think she was lying.
I think the real thief is trying to throw us off.
And the real thief has your necklace, right? That hasn't been recovered yet?
Exactly.
The plot thickens.
Kanchou?
Hm? What can I do for you?
I was told you wanted to talk to me?
That's certainly true.
You should probably talk to someone else about this. Maybe Lieutenant Guzman has some ideas.
Ah! I'm glad you think so.
*ALARM*
Right. Table it for now.
@BATTLE
Ah. Yes. I'm just looking for an informal report - you've been keeping your eyes on Ensign Mihaelova?
Hai. As you suggested.
No signs of erratic behavior?
None, Kanchou.
What about people around her acting erratically? Any obvious enemies - anyone who might hold a grudge?
No standouts. But, of course, we haven't had a lot of time to be idle.

Fields.MenuText: You're right.
I think he's convinced we've already got our woman.
I don't want this to devolve into another calvalcade of meetings, Chikuma.

Fields.DialogueText: That doesn't mean he won't be rational.
I'm not talking about bringing in a cast of thousands, Kanchou.
Hey, Guzman - come here.
Yes, Captain? What can I do for you?
There's something I wanted to discuss with you.
Is it about Ensign Mihaelova?
It is. Chikuma spoke to her. We have doubts about her involvement.
What doubts could you have? I caught her red-handed.
What, Captain?
I thought you said that you had an anonymous source.
Sure. But I was the one who checked her quarters.
I overheard you two discussing Elizaveta.
You should tell Officer Guzman your opinion.
I don't think that Elizaveta is the real thief. The items in her room were put there by someone else.
How do you know that?
She told me. Well, I guess I can't know for sure.
With all due respect, she's probably lying. It's the obvious thing for her to do in this situation.
I don't think she is. When a member of my crew looks me in the eye and swears she's telling the truth, I think I know when she isn't. And she was.

Fields.MenuText: I think Chikuma is right. I trust her intuitions with the crew.
Officer Guzman does have a point.
Chikuma and I think she is being framed.

Fields.DialogueText: Why would she steal a drinking glass and a pen? The real thief is probably trying to frame her.
I still trust her. We haven't found the necklace yet. The real thief could be framing her.
Hai. Why would she steal a pen and a drinking glass and then leave them out for others to find?
Well...
Lieutenant Guzman, you said you had an anonymous source. Maybe this person is up to something.
I think it may be time to remove the anonymity.
*ALARM*
Looks like it will have to wait.
@BATTLE
Lieutenant. A word, please.
Captain? You want to continue our discussion, no doubt.
That's right.
Your thought that Elizaveta is being framed seems interesting, but I remain suspicious of her. In fact, I'm still confident she's the thief.
The stolen items were found in her quarters. It seems likely she stole these things - and it's likely she has Chikuma's necklace too.

Fields.MenuText: She's got one thing stashed in a secure hiding place and everything else just scattered under her bunk? Does that sound right to you?
No, it doesn't add up. I really don't think it's her.
She's under observation. If you're right, she'll slip up. But until her guilt is proven, I don't mean to let my guard down.

Fields.DialogueText: I admit it's weird, but maybe it's a very small space. The basic fact is: she's new to the crew, and all of this started around the time she came aboard.
There's no one else to suspect. Plus, she's new to the crew, and all of this started around the time she came aboard.
Fair enough. But, Captain, she's new to the crew, and all of this started around the time she came aboard.
I do take your point.
Thank you, Captain.
I'll think about it.
*ALARM*
All crew to your stations!
@BATTLE
Chikuma!
Ah, Kanchou! This must be about my missing necklace.
Yes, I spoke to Officer Guzman.
Oh, again?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah. If nothing else, he's made a case that Mihaelova hasn't been here long enough to make enemies.
He argued for Mihaelova's guilt, but I'm not convinced.
Yeah. Wasn't all that productive.

Fields.DialogueText: ... I think I should speak to her again. Maybe I can get another clue.
That's wise, Kanchou. There is obviously more going on here.
He'll come around.
You see...
Kanchou! I have an issue that I feel strongly about.
Kishibe! Good to see you up and about. What do you need?
I'd like to discuss Elizaveta. She tells me that she's been accused of being a thief!
There was some evidence that pointed in her direction, but-
She would never steal. I know she's new to the ship, but I have tremendous confidence in her. I would like to attest to her character!
That's strong language, Kishibe.
I know. But I'm willing to stake my reputation. Can you tell me who would accuse her of this?
Officer Guzman has an anonymous source.
The anonymous source is starting to seem very suspicious now, Kanchou.
You're right. But Kishibe, do you have any specific evidence for us? Anything that can conclusively put Mihaelova in the clear?
Well, I....
Understood. Listen, nobody's out to railroad her. We'll get the guilty party in the end, and the innocent will be fine.
No, I suppose I don't.
... Thank you, Kanchou. I appreciate that.
Right. Guzman, you need to reveal your anonymous source.
Hai. It's important for the investigation.
Whoever it is might have more information - information we need.
Whoever it is may also have my necklace.
It's anonymous, though...
Assuming everything's above board, it won't go farther than the three of us, Guzman. There's really no reason not to say.
What is it, Lieutenant Guzman?
*ALARM*
Right. Get to your post - but report back to me when the shooting stops. This has already dragged on too long.
@BATTLE
Guzman, what's going on? Why won't you reveal your anonymous source?
Well, Captain... I, er...
Oh! There is no source. It's just Lieutenant Guzman!

Fields.MenuText: Guzman, you're the one trying to frame Mihaelova?
Is that true, Lieutenant?
Why would you lie about it, Guzman?

Fields.DialogueText: No, of course not!
It was. I have to admit.
Well...
I suspected Elizaveta because she was new to the crew. I inspected her quarters without proof. I didn't want to reveal that...
I don't think that kind of suspicion is very fair, Guzman.
You're right. I shouldn't have done it - but when I saw my drinking glass...
Noted. Get about your business, Lieutenant - we'll be following up on this in due course.
Yes, Captain.
Maybe Officer Guzman is also a suspect now.
I don't believe it, Kanchou. The Lieutenant is a good man!
Good men can have bad days, Chikuma.
We're not talking about slipping up under pressure, Kanchou. We're talking about hurting the career of a fellow crew member and then lying to our faces about it.
Neither do I, to be honest.
Okay. So let's be clear - would you be willing to swear under oath that you did not plant the stolen goods in Ensign Mihaelova's quarters?
Yes, Captain. Maybe I didn't go through the proper channels, but I swear I'm not out to frame anybody. And I'm no thief!
And doing it convincingly, at that.
Hai. I just don't see it.
Captain, enemy ships approaching.
@BATTLE
Kanchou!
Yes, Chikuma? What's the matter?
It's my print. The new print I have been working on is gone!
You don't say.
I do say. I'm saying it now!
This is bad news.
Hai! It is.
This makes me think that it's probably not Guzman or Elizaveta. Why would either of them do something so risky when they are both suspects?
It's true. That doesn't make much sense.  Oh, what should we do, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: I'm open to suggestions.
Throw random crew members in the brig for a week at a time and see when the thefts stop?
I say we catch the thief in the act.

Fields.DialogueText: ... I might have an idea.
Or... we could set a trap.
I think I know what to do.
What's your plan?
I'll put some of my other prints out around my quarters, and I'll make sure the crew knows they're there.
That might be tempting for a thief.
Then it's just a matter of keeping some of my attention on that place at all times. I think I can make it work.
It's worth a try.
Kanchou!
Did you learn anything new about the thief?
Hai! I know who it is. I can't believe it.
Who is it?
*ALARM*
Funayūrei!
Wait. Are you telling me they're out there, or that they're responsible for the thefts?
The latter. I'll see you on the bridge.
@BATTLE
Chikuma!
Hai. I know, Kanchou. You want me to tell you who the thief is.
Please.
I'm needed in the infirmary, Kanchou, so I can't give you the full report - but the culprit is Kishibe.

Fields.MenuText: Kishibe? I'm shocked!
You're sure?
Hence his vehemence in protesting Mihaelova's innocence. Hm.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. There's more to it, though.
Hai. It's not Guzman, or Elizaveta. It was Kishibe - but that's not the whole story.
Not... necessarily. Kanchou, there's more to the story.
I'm curious.
I don't think he was conscious when he did it.
Oh, come on!
I swear she's just messing with my head now...
I'll tell you more later. Right now I really need to-
Understood.
Kanchou? If this is a good time, I need to tell you the rest.
Yes, tell me what else I need to know about Kishibe.
I found him at the door of my quarters at night, when I was expected to be on the bridge. I confronted him.
You did? What happened?
Nothing. He didn't try to hide. He just kept trying to push his way inside my room. Then I noticed that he wasn't responsive.
What do you mean?
I believe Kishibe is a sleepwalker. He's not aware of any of this.
*ALARM*
Let's get to work.
@BATTLE
Captain, look at this!
It's Chikuma's missing print.
I found it in Elizaveta's quarters. I wasn't searching. I simply found it while doing some routine checks.
This again? Officer Guzman, we believe we know who the thief is now. Chikuma saw Kishibe trying to steal from her room, but he was sleepwalking.
What...? That's bizarre. Then why do all of these things keep showing up around Elizaveta?
Yes, and where is Chikuma's necklace?
So, Officer Guzman, you know now?
Yes, but I found this by Elizaveta's quarters.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe Kishibe is going to Elizaveta's quarters while he sleepwalks.
So is Kishibe trying to frame her?
Elizaveta could have some kind of a spell on Kishibe.

Fields.DialogueText: This could be it. We should speak to Kishibe.
I don't think so. He's asleep. Maybe there's some other reason that he's going to her quarters.
She's much too cute to be a witch, Kanchou. I'm sure there is some other reason Kishibe is going to her quarters.
Captain, it's an ambush!
Evasive action, now!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I've brought Kishibe here.
Kanchou? What is this about?
I can't think of a way to sugarcoat this. You're stealing things in your sleep.
Yes, Kishibe. It's true. You're a sleepwalking kleptomaniac.
I... have been having dreams. I... I'm ashamed.

Fields.MenuText: Don't be ashamed, Kishibe. You're not conscious while it's happening.
You don't need to be ashamed. You do need to be examined. Thoroughly.
What's wrong with you, Kishibe?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Kishibe. Don't worry. I don't blame you.
For your own good!
It is strange that you are stealing, Kishibe.
The eye again.
Yes.
I'll look into it, Kanchou. If the darkness is active on board, it's not as strong as it was. I should be able to shut it out more completely.
It's not important, but... do you have any idea where I can find my necklace?
I... I'm sorry. I don't know.
Any idea why would you be going to Elizaveta's room in your sleep, Kishibe?
I suppose I should just say it. We're in love. I go to her quarters often.
Ah.
How sweet!
I think it must have something to do with these vivid dreams. I've had them since my injury. The eye, closing...
Chikuma? Would you be able to sense if he's being controlled? We need to know if Morganas are influencing him, or if this is just his subconscious mind's way of... I don't know what.
And if that's not it, then we'll get you the help you need, Kishibe.
... Please don't make me stop flying. Being crazy never hurt a pilot in wartime, right?
One thing at a time.
Let me just check in here.
Here it is... and here is the first draft of my letter!
Chikuma!
Kanchou?
I found your necklace. It was in Kishibe's aircraft.
Yatta! I'm so happy to have it again. Thank you for helping me find it.
What does the inscription say? I've been meaning to ask you.
It says, "flow away with the river." It's because I am named after a river, Kanchou.
And now I guess it's time for me to finally write a letter to Takao.
What are you going to say in it?

Fields.MenuText: I'm going to say what a great mystery this has all been.
I'm going to write that I have an excellent Belle to work with.
That she should talk to me in person from now on.

Fields.DialogueText: Hasn't it been?!
You're the best kanchou, Kanchou.
I wouldn't hold your breath, Kanchou.
Heh.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Works for me.
By the way, we should probably talk about Kishibe. If we send him back to the mainland with this story hanging over him, that's probably the end of his career.
Have him sleep under observation for the next couple of weeks, see if his nighttime behavior stabilizes. If it does, we'll see.
Kanchou... I don't think the Funayūrei were controlling him. I think his mind was hurt, and I think he was trying to impress Elizaveta. It's under control now - or at least it can be.
Well, I'm prepared to give him another shot.
I'd also like you to try another one of those exorcisms - or whatever you want to call them. If there's any Morgana influence here, and if that's what he's reacting to...
Hai! I'll fix it!
That would be another reason to keep him around, actually. If he's sensitive to Morgana powers now, he might be incredibly useful as early warning.
Hai. Um... speaking of which....
